title.value: Simulating federated learning for steatosis detection using ultrasound images
title.justification: The title explicitly states the focus of the paper: simulating federated learning for detecting steatosis using ultrasound images.
title.quote: Simulating federated learning for steatosis detection using ultrasound images

extractions.description: The paper investigates the use of federated learning for detecting steatosis using ultrasound images. It evaluates four federated learning algorithms with various data partitioning strategies to understand the impact of data distribution on model performance. The study uses both a private and a public dataset and compares the performance of different models and setups.

type.justification: The paper describes experiments and simulations conducted with real datasets to evaluate the performance of different federated learning algorithms.
type.quote: We aimed to implement four data partitioning strategies evaluated with four federated learning (FL) algorithms and investigate the impact of data distribution on FL model performance in detecting steatosis using B-mode US images.

name.justification: The paper focuses on using ultrasound images for detecting steatosis, a medical imaging application.
name.quote: Steatosis assessment using ultrasound images has demonstrated the superiority of deep learning-based approaches over hepatorenal index method and gray-level co-occurrence matrix algorithm.

name.justification: The paper's primary method of study is federated learning, exploring different algorithms within this domain.
name.quote: A systematic assessment of the impact of various data distributions would help inform the use of various FL algorithms for clinical use.

name.justification: This subfield is mentioned as it involves using B-mode ultrasound images for detection purposes.
name.quote: The purpose of this study was to implement four data partitioning strategies... for the detection of hepatic steatosis using deep learning on B-mode US images.

name.justification: The paper specifically mentions the use of a VGG16-based model for detecting steatosis, emphasizing its role in the study.
name.quote: We used a VGG16-based model, known for its effectiveness in detecting steatosis on B-mode ultrasound images.

is_contributed.justification: The VGG16-based model is used as a tool in the study, not as a novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We used a VGG16-based model, known for its effectiveness in detecting steatosis on B-mode ultrasound images.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes running simulations using the VGG16-based model, indicating it was executed.
is_executed.quote: To create a simulated FL environment, we employed three virtual computers, each equipped with an NVIDIA GRID V100-16Q GPU.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of this model using different federated learning algorithms and scenarios.
is_compared.quote: We investigated the impact of class imbalance and the mismatch between the global and local data distributions on the learning outcome.

referenced_paper_title.value: Very deep convolutional networks for large-scale image recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The VGG16 model design is widely attributed to this foundational paper by Simonyan and Zisserman.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Simonyan, K. & Zisserman, A. Very deep convolutional networks for large-scale image recognition.

name.value: Private dataset from the Centre Hospitalier de l’Université de Montréal (CHUM)
name.justification: The private dataset is one of the primary datasets used in the study for training and testing models.
name.quote: A private dataset (153 patients; 1530 images) included in this retrospective study.

referenced_paper_title.value: Comparison of radiologists and deep learning for US grading of hepatic steatosis
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced prior study mentions the use of a deep learning model trained on the dataset from a single institution.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The private dataset included in the current study was published in a prior study.

name.value: Public dataset from Medical University of Warsaw
name.justification: A public dataset sourced from the Medical University of Warsaw is used for the study.
name.quote: Two datasets collected at separate sites were used in the current study: a publicly available dataset acquired in the Medical University of Warsaw, Poland.

referenced_paper_title.value: Transfer learning with deep convolutional neural network for liver steatosis assessment in ultrasound images
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference provides context for the use of these ultrasound images for liver steatosis assessment, as mentioned in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Byra, M. et al. Transfer learning with deep convolutional neural network for liver steatosis assessment in ultrasound images.

name.justification: The Flower FL framework is explicitly mentioned as being used for the federated learning simulations.
name.quote: ...the Flower FL framework, which allowed us to establish one server and two sites.

referenced_paper_title.value: Flower: a friendly federated learning research framework
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Flower framework was referenced, showing its contribution to federated learning simulations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Flower: a friendly federated learning research framework.

name.justification: TensorFlow is listed among the software tools used in the study, specifically as the deep learning framework.
name.quote: Software was developed in Python...and tensorflow (version 2.12.0).

referenced_paper_title.value: TensorFlow: Large-Scale Machine Learning on Heterogeneous Systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: This document is a primary reference for work related to TensorFlow, acknowledging its foundational role in machine learning applications.
referenced_paper_title.quote: TensorFlow: Large-Scale Machine Learning on Heterogeneous Systems.
